intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. pseudoplacerum, commonly known as the false sand harebell, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish to reddish flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. This subspecies is typically found in dry, disturbed soils in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It has a low-growing habit and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. The plant is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient member of its ecological community.
